Name: PN_BASE
column6: Four-digit “base” part number, one nibble per digit.

Name: PN_BASE
column6: Example: Si5395A-A-GM. The base part number
(OPN) is 5395, which is stored in this register.

Name: GRADE
Description: One ASCII character indicating the device speed/synthesis mode.

Name: DEVICE_REV
Description: One ASCII character indicating the device revision level.
Example Si5395C-A12345-GM, the device revision is “A” and
0 = Industrial (–40° C to 85° C) ambient conditions

Name: I2C_ADDR
Description: The upper five bits of the 7-bit I2C address.The lower two bits are controlled by the A1 and A0 pins.Note: This register is not bank burnable.

Name: LOSXAXB
Description: 1 if there is no signal at the XAXB pins.

Name: XAXB_ERR
Description: 1 if there is a problem locking to the XAXB inputsignal.

Name: SMBUS_TIMEOUT
Description: 1 if there is an SMBus timeout error.

Name: LOS
Description: 1 if the clock input is currently LOS

Name: OOF
Description: 1 if the clock input is currently OOF

Name: LOL
Description: 1 if the DSPLL is out of lock

Name: HOLD
Description: 1 if the DSPLL is in holdover (or free run)

Name: CAL_PLL
Description: 1 if the DSPLL internal calibration is busy

Name: SYSINCAL_FLG
Description: Sticky version of SYSINCAL. Write a 0 to this bitto clear.

Name: LOSXAXB_FLG
Description: Sticky version of LOSXAXB. Write a 0 to this bitto clear.

Name: XAXB_ERR_FLG
Description: Sticky version of XAXB_ERR.Write a 0 to thisbit to clear.

Name: SMBUS_TIMEOUT_FLG
Description: Sticky version of SMBUS_TIMEOUT. Write a 0to this bit to clear.

Name: LOS_FLG
Description: 1 if the clock input is LOS for the given input

Name: OOF_FLG
Description: 1 if the clock input is OOF for the given input

Name: HOLD_FLG
Description: 1 if the DSPLL was in holdover or free run

Name: CAL_FLG_PLL
Description: 1 if the internal calibration was busy

Name: SYSINCAL_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask SYSINCAL_FLG from causing an in-

Name: LOSXAXB_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask the LOSXAXB_FLG from causing an

Name: SMBUS_TIMEOUT_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask SMBUS_TIMEOUT_FLG from the in-

Name: RESERVED
Description: Factory set to 1 to mask reserved bit from caus-
ing an interrupt. Do not clear this bit.

Name: RESERVED
Description: Factory set to 1 to mask reserved bit from caus-
ing an interrupt. Do not clear this bit.

Name: LOS_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask the clock input LOS flag

Name: OOF_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask the clock input OOF flag

Name: LOL_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask the clock input LOL flag

Name: CAL_INTR_MSK
Description: 1 to mask the DSPLL internal calibration busy flag

Name: SOFT_RST_ALL
Description: 1 Initialize and calibrates the entire device0 No effect

Name: FINC
Description: 1 a rising edge will cause the selected MultiSynth toincrement the output frequency by the Nx_FSTEPW pa-rameter. See registers 0x0339–0x0358

Name: FDEC
Description: 1 a rising edge will cause the selected MultiSynth todecrement the output frequency by the Nx_FSTEPWparameter. See registers 0x0339–0x0358

Name: PDN
Description: 1 to put the device into low-power mode

Name: HARD_RST
Description: 1 causes hard reset. The same as power up except thatthe serial port access is not held at reset.0 No reset

Name: SYNC
Description: 1 to reset all output R dividers to the same state.

Name: LOS_EN
Description: 1 to enable LOS for a clock input;0 for disable

Name: LOSXAXB_DIS
Description: Enable LOS detection on the XAXB inputs.0: Enable LOS Detection (default)1: Disable LOS Detection

Name: LOS0_VAL_TIME
Description: Clock Input 00 for 2 msec1 for 100 msec2 for 200 msec3 for one second

Name: OOF_REF_SEL
Description: 0 for CLKIN01 for CLKIN12 for CLKIN23 for CLKIN34 for XAXB

Name: OOF0_DIV_SEL
Description: Sets a divider for the OOF circuitry for each input clock
0,1,2,3. The divider value is 2OOFx_DIV_SEL. CBPro sets

Name: OOF0_SET_THR
Description: OOF Set threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps of

Name: OOF1_SET_THR
Description: OOF Set threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps of

Name: OOF2_SET_THR
Description: OOF Set threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps of

Name: OOF3_SET_THR
Description: OOF Set threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps of

Name: OOF0_CLR_THR
Description: OOF Clear threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps

Name: OOF1_CLR_THR
Description: OOF Clear threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps

Name: OOF2_CLR_THR
Description: OOF Clear threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps

Name: OOF3_CLR_THR
Description: OOF Clear threshold. Range is up to ±500 ppm in steps

Name: LOL_FST_EN
Description: Enables fast detection of LOL. A large input frequency
error will quickly assert LOL when this is enabled.

Name: LOL_SLOW_EN_PLL
Description: 1 to enable LOL; 0 to disable LOL.

Name: LOL_SLW_SET_THR
Description: Configures the loss of lock set thresholds. Selectableas 0.1, 0.3, 1, 3, 10, 30, 100, 300, 1000, 3000, 10000.Values are in ppm.

Name: LOL_SLW_CLR_THR
Description: Configures the loss of lock set thresholds. Selectableas 0.1, 0.3, 1, 3, 10, 30, 100, 300, 1000, 3000, 10000.Values are in ppm.

Name: ACTIVE_NVM_BANK
Description: 0x03 when no NVM burn by customer
0x0F when 1 NVM bank has been burned by
0x3F when 2 NVM banks have been burned by

Name: NVM_WRITE
Description: Write 0xC7 to initiate an NVM bank burn.

Name: NVM_READ_BANK
Description: When set, this bit will read the NVM down into

Name: FASTLOCK_EXTEND_EN
Description: Extend Fastlock bandwidth period past LOL

Name: FASTLOCK_EXTEND
Description: 29-bit value. Set by CBPro to minimize the phase transi-
ents when switching the PLL bandwidth.

Name: DEVICE_READY
Description: Ready Only byte to indicate device is ready. When readdata is 0x0F one can safely read/write registers. Thisregister is repeated on every page therefore a pagewrite is not ever required to read the DEVICE_READYstatus.

Name: OUTALL_DISABLE_LOW
Description: 1 Pass through the output enables, 0 disablesall output drivers

Name: OUT0A_PDN
Description: Powerdown output driver.0: Normal Operation (default)1: Powerdown output driverWhen powered down, outputs pinswill be high impedance with a lightpull down effect.

Name: OUT0A_OE
Description: Enable/Disable individual output.0: Disable output (default)1: Enable output

Name: OUT0A_RDIV_FORCE2
Description: Force R0A output divider divide-by-2.0: R0A_REG sets divide value (de-fault)1: Divide value forced to divide-by-2

Name: OUT0A_FORMAT
Description: Select output format.0: Reserved1: Differential Normalmode2: Differential Low-Powermode3: Reserved4: LVCMOS single ended5–7: Reserved

Name: OUT0A_SYNC_EN
Description: Synchronous Enable/Dis-able selection.0: Asynchronous Ena-ble/Disable (default)1: Synchronous Ena-ble/Disable (Glitchless)

Name: OUT0A_DIS_STATE
Description: Determines the logicstate of the output driverwhen disabled:0: Disable logic Low1: Disable logic High2-3: Reserved

Name: OUT0A_CMOS_DRV
Description: LVCMOS output impe-dance selection. See6.3.5 LVCMOS OutputImpedance and DriveStrength Selectionfor val-id selections.

Name: OUT0A_CM
Description: OUT0A Common ModeVoltage selection. On-ly applies whenOUT0A_FORMAT=1 or2.

Name: OUT0A_AMPL
Description: OUT0A Differential Am-plitude setting. Only ap-plies when OUT0A_FOR-MAT=1 or 2.

Name: OUT0A_MUX_SEL
Description: OUT0A output source divider select.0: N0 is the source for OUT0A1: N1 is the source for OUT0A2: N2 is the source for OUT0A3: N3 is the source for OUT0A4: N4 is the source for OUT0A5-7: Reserved

Name: OUT0A_VDD_SEL_EN
Description: Output Driver VDD Select Enable. Set to 1for normal operation.

Name: OUT0A_VDD_SEL
Description: Output Driver VDD Select0: 3.3 V1: 1.8 V2: 2.5 V3: Reserved

Name: OUT0A_INV
Description: OUT0A output LVCMOS inversion. Onlyapplies when OUT0A_FORMAT= 4. See6.3.7 LVCMOS Output Polarity for moreinformation.

Name: OUTX_ALWAYS_ON
Description: This setting is managed by CBProduring zero delay mode.

Name: OUT_DIS_LOSXAXB_MSK
Description: Determines if outputs are disabledduring an LOSXAXB condition.0: All outputs disabled on LOSXAXB1: All outputs remain enabled duringLOSXAXB condition

Name: OUT_DIS_MSK_LOL
Description: 0: LOL will disable all connected out-puts1: LOL does not disable any outputs

Name: OUT_PDN_ALL
Description: 0- no effect1- all drivers powered down

Name: PXAXB
Description: Sets the prescale divider for the input clock

Name: P0_UPDATE
Description: 0 - No update for P-divider value1 - Update P-divider value

Name: P0_FRACN_MODE
Description: P0 (IN0) input divider fractional mode. Mustbe set to 0xB for proper operation.

Name: P0_FRAC_EN
Description: P0 (IN0) input divider fractional enable0: Integer-only division.1: Fractional (or Integer) division.

Name: P1_FRACN_MODE
Description: P1 (IN1) input divider fractional mode. Mustbe set to 0xB for proper operation.

Name: P1_FRAC_EN
Description: P1 (IN1) input divider fractional enable0: Integer-only division.1: Fractional (or Integer) division.

Name: P2_FRACN_MODE
Description: P2 (IN2) input divider fractional mode. Mustbe set to 0xB for proper operation.

Name: P2_FRAC_EN
Description: P2 (IN2) input divider fractional enable0: Integer-only division.1: Fractional (or Integer) division.
Must be set to 0xB for proper operation.

Name: MXAXB_UPDATE
Description: Set to 1 to update the MXAXB_NUM and
MXAXB_DEN values. A SOFT_RST may also be
R0A_REG = 0 will not set the out-
put to divide-by-2. See notes be-

Name: DESIGN_ID0
Description: ASCII encoded string defined by CBPro user, withuser defined space or null padding of unusedcharacters. A user will normally include a configu-ration ID + revision ID. For example, “ULT.1A” withnull character padding sets:DESIGN_ID0: 0x55DESIGN_ID1: 0x4CDESIGN_ID2: 0x54DESIGN_ID3: 0x2EDESIGN_ID4: 0x31DESIGN_ID5: 0x41DESIGN_ID6:0x 00DESIGN_ID7: 0x00

Name: OPN_ID0
Description: OPN unique identifier. ASCII encoded. For exam-ple, with OPN:5395C-A12345-GM, 12345 is the OPN uniqueidentifier, which sets:OPN_ID0: 0x31OPN_ID1: 0x32OPN_ID2: 0x33OPN_ID3: 0x34OPN_ID4: 0x35

Name: FASTLOCK_EXTEND_SCL
Description: Scales LOLB_INT_TIM-ER_DIV256. Set by CBPro

Name: N0_UPDATE
Description: Set this bit to update the N0 divider.

Name: N_UPDATE_ALL
Description: Set this bit to update all five N dividers.

Name: N4_UPDATE
Description: Set this bit to update N4 divider.

Name: N_FSTEP_MSK
Description: 0 to enable FINC/FDEC updates1 to disable FINC/FDEC updates

Name: ZDM_IN_SEL
Description: Clock input select when in ZD mode.
0 for IN0, 1 for IN1,2 for IN2,
Note: In ZD mode the feedback clock

Name: IN_ACTV
Description: Currently selected DSPLL input clock.0: IN01: IN12: IN23: IN3

Name: BW_UPDATE_PLL
Description: Must be set to 1 to update theBWx_PLL and FAST_BWx_PLLparameters

Name: M_UPDATE
Description: Set this bit to update the M divider.
Must be set to 0xB for proper operation.
0 to disable auto fast lock when the DSPLL is out

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW_SEL1
Description: Holdover Exit Bandwidth select. Selects the exit
bandwidth from Holdover when ramped exit is dis-
0: Exit Holdover using Holdover Exit or Fastlock
1: Exit Holdover using the Normal loop bandwidth

Name: RAMP_STEP_INTERVAL
Description: Time Interval of the frequency ramp steps when
ramping between inputs or when exiting holdover.
Calculated by CBPro based on selection.

Name: FORCE_HOLD
Description: 0 for normal operation1 for force holdover

Name: HSW_EN
Description: 0 glitchless switching mode (phase buildoutturned off)1 hitless switching mode (phase buildoutturned on) 1

Bit Field: Note:1. Hitless switching and zero delay mode are incompatible.

Name: IN_LOS_MSK
Description: For each clock input LOS alarm:0 to use LOS in the clock selection logic1 to mask LOS from the clock selection logic

Name: IN_OOF_MSK
Description: For each clock input OOF alarm:0 to use OOF in the clock selection logic1 to mask OOF from the clock selection logic

Name: IN0_PRIORITY
Description: The priority for clock input 0 is:0 no priority1 for priority 12 for priority 23 for priority 34 for priority 45 to 7 are reserved

Name: IN1_PRIORITY
Description: The priority for clock input 1 is:0 no priority1 for priority 12 for priority 23 for priority 34 for priority 45 to 7 are reserved

Name: IN2_PRIORITY
Description: The priority for clock input 2 is:0 no priority1 for priority 12 for priority 23 for priority 34 for priority 45 to 7 are reserved

Name: IN3_PRIORITY
Description: The priority for clock input 3 is:0 no priority1 for priority 12 for priority 23 for priority 34 for priority 45 to 7 are reserved

Name: HSW_MODE
Description: 1: Default setting, do not modify0, 2, 3: Reserved

Name: HSW_PHMEAS_CTRL
Description: 0: Default setting, do not modify1, 2, 3: Reserved

Name: HOLD_HIST_VALID
Description: 1 = there is enough historical frequency da-ta collected for valid holdover.

Name: FASTLOCK_STATUS
Description: 1 = PLL is in Fast Lock operation

Name: AMBLE3
Description: This register is used when making certainchanges to the device. See Section 4.2 Dy-namic PLL Changes for more information.

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW0
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidthwhen exiting holdover, works with HOL-DEXIT_BW_SEL0 and HOLD_BW_SEL1

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW1
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidthwhen exiting holdover; works with HOL-DEXIT_BW_SEL0 and HOLD_BW_SEL1.

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW2
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidthwhen exiting holdover, works with HOL-DEXIT_BW_SEL0 and HOLD_BW_SEL1

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW3
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidthwhen exiting holdover, works with HOL-DEXIT_BW_SEL0 and HOLD_BW_SEL1

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW4
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidth
when exiting holdover, works with HOL-

Name: HOLDEXIT_BW5
Description: Set by CBPro to set the PLL bandwidth
when exiting holdover, works with HOL-

Name: RAMP_STEP_SIZE
Description: Size of the frequency ramp steps when
ramping between inputs or when exiting
Calculated by CBPro based on selection.

Name: XAXB_EXTCLK_EN
Description: 0 to use a crystal at the XAXB pins1 to use an external clock source at the XAXB pins

Name: IO_VDD_SEL
Description: 0 for 1.8 V external connections1 for 3.3 V external connections

Name: IN_EN
Description: 0: Disable and Powerdown Input Buffer1: Enable Input Buffer for IN3–IN0.

Name: IN_PULSED_CMOS_EN
Description: 0: Standard Input Format1: Pulsed CMOS Input Format for IN3–IN0. See Section5. Clock Inputs for more information.

Name: IN_CMOS_USE1P8
Description: 0 = selects the Pulsed CMOS input buffer mode1 = selects the LVCMOS input buffer mode

Name: N_CLK_TO_OUTX_EN
Description: Routes Multisynth outputs to output driver muxes.

Name: N_PIBYP
Description: Output Multisynth integer divide mode. Bit 0 for ID0, Bit1 for ID1, etc.0: Nx divider is fractional.1: Nx divider is integer.

Name: N_PDNB
Description: Powers down the N dividers.Set to 0 to power down unused N dividers.Must set to 1 for all active N dividers.See also related registers 0x0A03 and 0x0B4A.

Name: N0_PHASE_STEP
Description: N0 step size from 1 to 255 in units of Tvco, the VCO

Name: N0_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Lower byte of number of N0 step size changes.

Name: N0_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Upper byte of number of N0 step size changes.

Name: N0_PHASE_INC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase increment.

Name: N0_PHASE_DEC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase decrement.

Name: N1_PHASE_STEP
Description: N1 step size from 1 to 255 in units of Tvco, the VCO

Name: N1_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Lower byte of number of N1 step size changes.

Name: N1_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Upper byte of number of N1 step size changes.

Name: N1_PHASE_INC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase increment.

Name: N1_PHASE_DEC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase decrement.

Name: N2_PHASE_STEP
Description: N2 step size from 1 to 255 in units of Tvco, the VCOperiod.

Name: N2_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Lower byte of number of N2 step size changes.

Name: N2_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Upper byte of number of N2 step size changes.

Name: N2_PHASE_INC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase increment.

Name: N2_PHASE_DEC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase decrement.

Name: N3_PHASE_STEP
Description: N3 step size from 1 to 255 in units of Tvco, the VCOperiod.

Name: N3_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Lower byte of number of N3 step size changes.

Name: N3_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Upper byte of number of N3 step size changes.

Name: N3_PHASE_INC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase increment.

Name: N3_PHASE_DEC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase decrement.

Name: N4_PHASE_STEP
Description: N4 step size from 1 to 255 in units of Tvco, the VCOperiod.

Name: N4_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Lower byte of number of N4 step size changes.

Name: N4_PHASE_COUNT
Description: Upper byte of number of N4 step size changes.

Name: N4_PHASE_INC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase increment.

Name: N4_PHASE_DEC
Description: Writing a 1 initiates a phase decrement.

Name: MS_OD_G_TIMEOUT
Description: Controls the synchronous output disable timeout value

Name: PDIV_FRACN_CLK_DIS
Description: Clock disable for the fractional divide of the input P di-
viders. [P3, P2, P1, P0]. Must be set to 0 if the P divider
0: Enable the clock to the fractional divide part of the P
1: Disable the clock to the fractional divide part of the P

Name: FRACN_CLK_DIS_PLL
Description: Clock disable for the fractional divide of the M divider in
PLLB. Must be set to 0 if this M divider has a fractional
0: Enable the clock to the fractional divide part of the M
1: Disable the clock to the fractional divide part of the M
Digital OOF divider clock user disable. Bits 3:0 are for
IN3,2,1,0, Bit 4 is for OOF for the XAXB input.

Name: N_CLK_DIS
Description: Disable digital clocks to N dividers. Must be set to 0 to
use each N divider. See also related registers 0x0A03

Name: VCO_RESET_CALCODE
Description: 12-bit value. Controls the VCO frequency when a reset
